Sentencas: The reduction and oxidation of the solid solution Y2-xPrxO3+delta(0.0 <= x < 2.0 and delta <= 1.0) is investigated with emphasis on potential solid state electrolyte applications in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Oxygen trapping and cation site-splitting in Y(2-x)PrxO3+δ (0.0 ≤ x < 2.0 and δ ≤ 1.0)

Sentencas: The fully reduced solid solution Y2-xPrxO3 (0.0 <= x < 2.0) crystallizes in the bixbyite structure (Ia (3) over bar).
Titulo: Oxygen trapping and cation site-splitting in Y(2-x)PrxO3+δ (0.0 ≤ x < 2.0 and δ ≤ 1.0)

Sentencas: The oxidized solid solution Y2-xPrxO3+delta(0.0 <= x < 1.4) forms bixbyite phases (Ia<(3)over bar>) whereas Y2-xPrxO3+delta (1.4 <= x < 2) compositions form fully disordered defect fluorite structures (Fm<(3)over bar>m) with variable oxide defect concentrations.
Titulo: Oxygen trapping and cation site-splitting in Y(2-x)PrxO3+δ (0.0 ≤ x < 2.0 and δ ≤ 1.0)

Sentencas: The two cation positions are investigated in detail using synchrotron powder X-ray and time of flight neutron diffraction data.
Titulo: Oxygen trapping and cation site-splitting in Y(2-x)PrxO3+δ (0.0 ≤ x < 2.0 and δ ≤ 1.0)

Sentencas: In the bixbyite structures the 8c cation site splits into the 16c cation site and the 24d cation position migrates toward the ideal fluorite coordination upon oxidation.
Titulo: Oxygen trapping and cation site-splitting in Y(2-x)PrxO3+δ (0.0 ≤ x < 2.0 and δ ≤ 1.0)

Sentencas: Reductive in situ diffraction experiments reveal the co-existence of the fluorite and bixbyite structure only in a narrow temperature range.
Titulo: Oxygen trapping and cation site-splitting in Y(2-x)PrxO3+δ (0.0 ≤ x < 2.0 and δ ≤ 1.0)

Sentencas: During oxidation of the bixbyite phase a new 16c oxide anion site is populated.
Titulo: Oxygen trapping and cation site-splitting in Y(2-x)PrxO3+δ (0.0 ≤ x < 2.0 and δ ≤ 1.0)

Sentencas: The impact of the 16c oxide site population on the cation sublattice is being discussed.
Titulo: Oxygen trapping and cation site-splitting in Y(2-x)PrxO3+δ (0.0 ≤ x < 2.0 and δ ≤ 1.0)
